alert.note: Alert for Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 7:11PM PST until January 07 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Snow above 2000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 6 inches. * WHERE...The advisory area includes elevations above 2000 feet in eastern Curry, Josephine, eastern Douglas and Jackson Counties including the cities of Toketee Falls, Butte Falls, and Ashland. Impacted roadways include the lower I-5 passes of Sexton Summit and Canyon Mountain and portions of highways 140, 62, 138, and 238. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Sunday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels may lower to 1500 feet late tonight and early Sunday morning with light snow of generally less than an inch down to lower valley floors. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County
